<a id="AudioEffectSpectrumAnalyzer"></a>

# AudioEffectSpectrumAnalyzer

**Inherits:** [AudioEffect](AudioEffect.md) **\<** [Resource](Resource.md) **\<** [RefCounted](RefCounted.md) **\<** [Object](Object.md)

Audio effect that can be used for real-time audio visualizations.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

This audio effect does not affect sound output, but can be used for real-time audio visualizations.

This resource configures an [AudioEffectSpectrumAnalyzerInstance](AudioEffectSpectrumAnalyzerInstance.md), which performs the actual analysis at runtime. An instance can be obtained with [AudioServer.get_bus_effect_instance()](AudioServer.md#AudioServer_method_get_bus_effect_instance).

See also [AudioStreamGenerator](AudioStreamGenerator.md) for procedurally generating sounds.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Tutorials

- [Audio Spectrum Visualizer Demo](https://godotengine.org/asset-library/asset/2762)

## Enumerations

<a id="enum_AudioEffectSpectrumAnalyzer_FFTSize"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration -->

enum **FFTSize**: [ðŸ”—](#enum_AudioEffectSpectrumAnalyzer_FFTSize)

<a id="AudioEffectSpectrumAnalyzer_constant_FFT_SIZE_256"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[FFTSize](AudioEffectSpectrumAnalyzer.md#enum_AudioEffectSpectrumAnalyzer_FFTSize) **FFT_SIZE_256** = `0`

Use a buffer of 256 samples for the Fast Fourier transform. Lowest latency, but least stable over time.<a id="AudioEffectSpectrumAnalyzer_constant_FFT_SIZE_512"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[FFTSize](AudioEffectSpectrumAnalyzer.md#enum_AudioEffectSpectrumAnalyzer_FFTSize) **FFT_SIZE_512** = `1`

Use a buffer of 512 samples for the Fast Fourier transform. Low latency, but less stable over time.<a id="AudioEffectSpectrumAnalyzer_constant_FFT_SIZE_1024"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[FFTSize](AudioEffectSpectrumAnalyzer.md#enum_AudioEffectSpectrumAnalyzer_FFTSize) **FFT_SIZE_1024** = `2`

Use a buffer of 1024 samples for the Fast Fourier transform. This is a compromise between latency and stability over time.<a id="AudioEffectSpectrumAnalyzer_constant_FFT_SIZE_2048"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[FFTSize](AudioEffectSpectrumAnalyzer.md#enum_AudioEffectSpectrumAnalyzer_FFTSize) **FFT_SIZE_2048** = `3`

Use a buffer of 2048 samples for the Fast Fourier transform. High latency, but stable over time.<a id="AudioEffectSpectrumAnalyzer_constant_FFT_SIZE_4096"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[FFTSize](AudioEffectSpectrumAnalyzer.md#enum_AudioEffectSpectrumAnalyzer_FFTSize) **FFT_SIZE_4096** = `4`

Use a buffer of 4096 samples for the Fast Fourier transform. Highest latency, but most stable over time.<a id="AudioEffectSpectrumAnalyzer_constant_FFT_SIZE_MAX"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[FFTSize](AudioEffectSpectrumAnalyzer.md#enum_AudioEffectSpectrumAnalyzer_FFTSize) **FFT_SIZE_MAX** = `5`

Represents the size of the [FFTSize](AudioEffectSpectrumAnalyzer.md#enum_AudioEffectSpectrumAnalyzer_FFTSize) enum.<hr class="classref-section-separator"/>

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Property Descriptions

<a id="AudioEffectSpectrumAnalyzer_property_buffer_length"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[float](float.md) **buffer_length** = `2.0` [ðŸ”—](#AudioEffectSpectrumAnalyzer_property_buffer_length)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_buffer_length**\ (\ value\: [float](float.md)\ )
- [float](float.md) **get_buffer_length**\ (\ )

The length of the buffer to keep (in seconds). Higher values keep data around for longer, but require more memory.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="AudioEffectSpectrumAnalyzer_property_fft_size"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[FFTSize](AudioEffectSpectrumAnalyzer.md#enum_AudioEffectSpectrumAnalyzer_FFTSize) **fft_size** = `2` [ðŸ”—](#AudioEffectSpectrumAnalyzer_property_fft_size)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_fft_size**\ (\ value\: [FFTSize](AudioEffectSpectrumAnalyzer.md#enum_AudioEffectSpectrumAnalyzer_FFTSize)\ )
- [FFTSize](AudioEffectSpectrumAnalyzer.md#enum_AudioEffectSpectrumAnalyzer_FFTSize) **get_fft_size**\ (\ )

The size of the [Fast Fourier transform](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fast_Fourier_transform) buffer. Higher values smooth out the spectrum analysis over time, but have greater latency. The effects of this higher latency are especially noticeable with sudden amplitude changes.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

- [float](float.md) **get_tap_back_pos**\ (\ )
